attributes.action: Look to radically modify the Human Rights act to stop the use and abuse of it to defend the indefensible.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Human Rights Act - a serious and worthy piece of legislation. 

However, like most British people I believe it is being abused. People are using it to defend their 'preferences' for life styles. It is being used by criminals and crooks to frustrate the rule of law. Religions are using it to redefine what is permitted, and not permitted in this country.
Redraw or redefine the Act. Tell Europe it was envisaged to protect people from the horrors of torture and such events. It was not designed to be used by, for example, inmates in prison to demand pornography or by asylum seekers to defend their life-styles.
We the undersigned believe Enough is enough. Change this legislation.
